tool_description: Determines optimal planting dates based on weather forecasts, soil conditions, frost risk, and crop requirements to maximize yield potential.

crop_type.description: Type of crop to plant: corn, wheat, soybeans, rice, cotton, potatoes, tomatoes, or barley

latitude.description: Farm latitude for day length calculations (-90 to 90)

frost_risk_days.description: Number of days until last expected frost

weather_forecast_days.description: Forecasted daily temperatures for next 14 days

field_workability.description: Current field condition: too_wet, marginal, good, or excellent

risk_tolerance.description: Risk tolerance level: conservative, moderate, or aggressive

error_messages: Unsupported crop type: Use one of the supported crop types from the list.
Invalid latitude: Must be between -90 and 90 degrees.
Invalid soil conditions: Soil temperature must be between -10 and 40Â°C, moisture between 0-100%.
Invalid frost risk: Frost risk days must be non-negative integer less than 180.
Insufficient forecast: Need 7-14 days of temperature forecast data.
Invalid date range: If specified, earliest date must be before latest date.
usage: Provide crop type, location, current soil conditions, frost risk, weather forecast, and field workability. Optional date constraints and risk tolerance refine recommendations. Returns optimal planting windows.

yield_potential.description: Expected yield potential: low, moderate, or high
